etymologies: Middle English: shortening of Old French estudie (noun), estudier (verb), both based on Latin studium ‘zeal, painstaking application’

definitions: the devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge on an academic subject, especially by means of books

examples.text: the study of English
an application to continue full-time study

shortDefinitions: devotion of time and attention to gaining knowledge of academic subject

definitions: study as pursued by one person

examples.text: some students may not be able to resume their studies

shortDefinitions: time devoted by particular person to gaining knowledge of academic subject

definitions: an academic book or article on a particular topic

examples.text: a study of Jane Austen's novels

shortDefinitions: academic book or article on particular topic

definitions: used in the title of an academic subject

examples.text: a major in East Asian studies

shortDefinitions: used in title of academic subject

definitions: a detailed investigation and analysis of a subject or situation

examples.text: a study of a sample of 5,000 children
the study of global problems

shortDefinitions: detailed investigation and analysis of subject or situation

definitions: a portrayal in literature or another art form of an aspect of behavior or character

examples.text: a study of a man devoured by awareness of his own mediocrity

shortDefinitions: portrayal in literature or another art form of aspect of behaviour or character

definitions: a thing that is or deserves to be investigated; the subject of an individual's study

examples.text: I have made it my study to inspect other people's conduct

shortDefinitions: thing that is or deserves to be investigated

definitions: the object or aim of someone's endeavors

examples.text: the acquisition of a fortune is the study of all

shortDefinitions: object or aim of someone's endeavours

definitions: a person who learns a skill or acquires knowledge at a specified speed

examples.text: I'm a quick study

shortDefinitions: person who memorizes role at specified speed

definitions: a room used or designed for reading, writing, or academic work

examples.text: the third bedroom was used as a study

shortDefinitions: room used or designed for reading, writing, or academic work

definitions: a piece of work, especially a drawing, done for practice or as an experiment.
shortDefinitions: piece of work done for practice or as experiment

definitions: a musical composition designed to develop a player's technical skill.
shortDefinitions: musical composition designed to develop player's technical skill

definitions: a thing or person that is an embodiment or good example of something

examples.text: he perched on the edge of the bed, a study in confusion and misery

shortDefinitions: thing or person that is embodiment or good example of something

definitions: an amusing or remarkable thing or person

examples.text: Ira's face was a study as he approached the car

shortDefinitions: amusing or remarkable thing or person

definitions: devote time and attention to acquiring knowledge on (an academic subject), especially by means of books

examples.text: she studied biology and botany

shortDefinitions: devote time and attention to gaining knowledge of academic subject

definitions: investigate and analyze (a subject or situation) in detail

examples.text: he has been studying mink for many years

shortDefinitions: investigate and analyse subject or situation in detail

definitions: apply oneself to study

examples.text: he spent his time listening to the radio rather than studying

shortDefinitions: apply oneself to study

definitions: acquire academic knowledge at an educational establishment

examples.text: he studied at the Kensington School of Art

shortDefinitions: acquire academic knowledge at educational establishment

definitions: learn intensively about something, especially in preparation for a test of knowledge

examples.text: a graduate student studies up for her doctoral exams

shortDefinitions: learn intensively about something

definitions: (of an actor) try to learn (the words of one's role).
shortDefinitions: (of actor) try to learn

definitions: give serious thought or consideration to

examples.text: the people here don't make so much noise, so you will find that the government doesn't have us to study

shortDefinitions: give serious thought or consideration to

definitions: look at closely in order to observe or read

examples.text: she bent her head to study the plans

shortDefinitions: look at closely in order to observe or read

definitions: make an effort to achieve (a result) or take into account (a person or their wishes)

examples.text: with no husband to study, housekeeping is mere play

shortDefinitions: make effort to achieve result or take into account
